A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Spoilers ahead! 

I ask every hater to watch TLJ a second time. This is real Star Wars and it is almost everything you can expect as a true Star Wars fan.

Rian Johnson restored faith in Star Wars and he made the best he could out of the shit he took over from Abrams.

Johnson took a lot of risks to give us the best possible twists and great characters.

For example\, compare Adam Drivers performance from episode VII with episode VIII.

People were laughing at Kylo Ren the first time he took of his mask. The said "what a funny looking guy" or "seriously? That's the villain?".

Johnson made Kylo destroy the mask and brought us a true villain not in the need of wearing a mask.

Johnson made Luke throughing away his lightsaber\, which had a symbolic character to me saying: "what should I do with the shit you left over to me J.J.?

Rian killed Snoke now\, instead of making him the next emperor. What a great twist.

Lea used the force\, just like we wished get to be in VII. Luke was so damn strong at the end. Yeah\, that's what I wanted to see. He twisted all of the Empire and the audience using the force like no one did before. Yes I disliked Lukes dead at the end. But\, as Luke said: "we'll see us soon\, kid". He'll be back in IX I bet.

Johnson brought us Yoda back! 

The whole movie is filled with love to Star Wars\, to details\, to the magic and life in this universe. The movie is based on a simple base plot\, which carries a pretty complex build of side plots.

I bet most haters just weren't able to realize the complexity of TLJ. This is Star Wars and we should be thankful and supportive.

Love
Alex
